Package io.github.pranavavva.pokejavaapi

Class Move

java.lang.Object
io.github.pranavavva.pokejavaapi.Move
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public abstract class Move
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
The Move abstract class provides a foundation for concrete Move classes. All Moves have one and only one Type. All Moves additionally have a MoveCategory which determines whether a Pokemon deals/receives PHYSICAL damage, SPECIAL damage, or if the Move imparts a STATUS effect. NOTE: Some moves may be listed as Type.PHYSICAL but may actually cause damage using special stats. points refers to the number of times a Move can be used in battle (referred to as PP or Power Points). power refers to the damage power of the Move. Moves that impart a status effect only will have a power of zero. accuracy refers to the chance that a Move will succeed. Move field values will never be directly updated. Modifier effects (from Moves, Abilities, Items) are accounted for in the damage calculation equation.
See Also:
Pokemon, MoveCategory, Type, Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Move

      public Move​(java.lang.String name, Type type, MoveCategory category, int points, int power, double accuracy)
      The Move object constructor requires all 6 field values to be known in advance. In the future, Moves will have an auto-generated database reference ID to facilitate the storage of Moves in a database.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of the Move
      Returns:
      the name of the Move

    • getType

      public Type getType()
      Returns the Type of the Move
      Returns:
      the Type of the Move

    • getCategory

      public MoveCategory getCategory()
      Returns the MoveCategory of the Move. This will determine whether the PHYSICAL or SPECIAL battle stats of the Pokemon are used in damage calculation. STATUS moves will not impart damage, but they may impart a status effect.
      Returns:
      the MoveCategory of the Move

    • getPoints

      public int getPoints()
      Returns the Power Points available for the Move. Power Points are the number of uses a Move has in battle.
      Returns:
      the number of uses in battle for the Move

    • getPower

      public int getPower()
      Returns the power (attacking strength of the Move). This is not the actual amount of damage done, but it is a relative measure of how much damage moves used by the same exact Pokemon will do. Various factors are taken into how much damage is done, including the Types of both Pokemon, status effects, and Abilities.
      Returns:
      the power of the Move

    • getAccuracy

      public double getAccuracy()
      Returns the accuracy of the Move. This does not determine how much damage is done, but whether or not the move succeeds. A Move with an accuracy of 0.6 will succeed 60% of the time. A Move with an accuracy of 1.0 will always suceed.
      Returns:
      the accuracy of the Move
